Name: Working Myself Out of a Job
Notes/Contributors:
What if the solution to homeschool overwhelm isn't a new curriculum, but a laundry pile? 🧺
When I started homeschooling 5 kids under 6, I stumbled on something unexpected: teaching life skills wasn't just about raising capable kids—it was about creating a sustainable homeschool.
What's one life skill your kids are learning that's making your homeschool better? 👇
